RACE.RACE_TEXT: BC Cup Debutante S. HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR TWO YEAR OLD FILLIES. The nomination payment of $100 by midnight Saturday July 29, 2023 with $750 to enter and an additional $1,000 to start. A supplemental nomination fee of $2,500 will be accepted at the time of entry in addition to the races nomi nation, entry and start fees. 100% of all supplemental monies will be included in the $50,000 guaranteed purse. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth . Preference will be based upon the rules outlined in the Hastings condition book at the time of entry. Weight: 122 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 once allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of $12,000 once allowed 5 lbs. Non-winners of $8,000 once allowed 7 lbs. Field limited to 11 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIZZIE'S RAYNE broke sharply and tracked the pacesetter into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, assumed command leaving the turn, and drew clear late to prove best. WEEKENDINDELMAR was off a step slow, and found herself trailing the field into the first turn while saving ground at the rail, raced into a stalking trip from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, commenced her bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly two out from the rail in the drive to get up for the place. DONNA WYN away alertly and rushed to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backside, battled from the inside of LIZZIE'S RAYNE through the final turn, was unable to match strides with that rival leaving the turn, and was outfinished late for the place. BAKBURNER chased the leaders three wide entering the first turn, dropped back to trail entering the backstretch, began to lose touch with the field in the run to the final turn, and was eased over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Donna Wyn
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Weekendindelmar
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, trailed, stalked rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lizzie's Rayne
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing Breen Racing Chan Eugene and Milburn Dave
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Bakburner
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3 wide, trailed, eased

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BC Cup Distaff H. HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 92. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday July 29, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to seco nd, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back.High Weights preferred. Total earnings as recorded by Equibase in 2022-2023 Will be used in determining pr eference of horses assigned equal weights. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INFINITE PATIENCE broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering he first turn, eased off the pressured pace of BAYAKOAS IMAGE to gain a tracking trip one out from the rail entering the second turn, swept to the lead two wide approaching the final turn, battled through the turn from the inside of WE BE THREE while racing out from the rail, and held that determined rival safely at bay in the stretch drive under confident handling. WE B THREE was off a step slow and settled off the early contested pace while racing just out from the rail through the stretch the first time, took up the chase three wide midway down the backstretch, rallied three wide from the outside of INFINITE PATIENCE entering he the final turn, and finished gamely three wide in the drive to prove easily second best. BAYAKOAS IMAGE away alertly and dueled for the lead two wide entering he first turn, assumed command from along the rail entering the second turn, was quickly overtaken in the run to the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Infinite Patience
ENTRY.OWNER: Decoursey William and R N H Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, best

ENTRY.NAME: We B Three
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, settle inside, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Bayakoas Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Nite and Day Stable and Todd, Joanne
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2w, led, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 3/8M Dirt CR: 80. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 15000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $4,000 OR LESS ($5,000 BC BRED) AT THE CURRENT MEET OR CLAIMING PRICE $4,000 ($5,000 BC BRED). Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3, 000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKEITORBREAKIT raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch the first time and through the second turn, opened a clear advantage through the stretch the second time, continued to show the way in the run down the backstretch the final time, and widened his advantage over the final furlong while confidently handled. GORKY PARK stalked the leader into the backstretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained a tracking trip throughout, launched his bid three wide from between rivals entering the final turn, and finished willingly two wide in the drive to get up for the place. BARNEY GOOGLE unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the backstretch the first time, continued to bid his time at the back of the pack through the stretch the second time and into the backside, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly from along the inside in the drive to get up for a share. GOOD BYE PUTIN stalked the early pacesetter while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch the first time, maintained a stalking trip through the backside the final time, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and closed five wide in the drive in an even effort. DON WITH THE WIND tracked the leader into the backstretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, continued to track the pacesetter down the backside the final time, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, but weakened in the late stages. MOUNT LOKI settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backside the first time, dropped back to trail entering the final turn, and had little to offer in the late stages. Following the running of this race there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of GOOD BYE PUTIN lodged a claim of foul against the rider of GORKY PARK for alleged interference entering the final turn. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Barney Google
ENTRY.OWNER: Roberts-Henson Michelle Henson Brad Henson Randy Henson Dan and Irwin Trevor
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Good Bye Putin
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Mount Loki
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, clear lead, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Gorky Park
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Don With the Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BC Cup Hong Kong Jockey Club H. HASTINGS RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 82. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEAR OLD FILLIES. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday July 29, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back.High Weights preferred. Lifetime earnings as recorded by Equibase will be used in determining preference of horses assigned equal weights. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AIR FORCE away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, dictated the pace in the run down the backstretch, maintained her advantage into the final turn, and held MATSQUI safely at bay late to prove best. MATSQUI stalked the leaders into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backside, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, shifted four wide for the drive and closed willingly late to get up for the place. KEY TO SUCCESS tracked the leaders from just off the rail through the stretch the first time, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, continued to save ground through the final turn, and closed two wide in the drive to garner a share. ABOVE AVERAGE away well and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, held her tracking trip in the run to the final turn, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but needed more late while finishing two wide in the drive. LOLA M broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of AIR FORCE through the stretch the first time, eased off her pace rival and tracked that foe two wide in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was outfinished late. ARUNDEL CASTLE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, bided her time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide into the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Arundel Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Lyle Johnson Mark V and Harding Clive
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Matsqui
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Elder Matt and Breen Bill
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Key to Success
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Air Force
ENTRY.OWNER: Dale Dennis Peter Morris and Welsh Ed
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Lola M
ENTRY.OWNER: Nite and Day Stable Todd Joanne and S and D Holdings
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Above Average
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BC Cup Nursery S. HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR TWO YEAR OLDS. The nomination payment of $100 by midnight Saturday July 29, 2023 with $750 to enter and an additional $1,000 to start. A supplemental nomination fee of $2,500 will be accepted at the time of entry in addition to the races nomination, entry and start fees. 100% of all supplemental monies will be included in the $50,000 guaranteed purse. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth. Prefere nce will be based upon the rules outlined in the Hastings condition book at the time of entry. Weight: 122 lbs. Fillies: 119 lbs. Non-winners of $27,500 once allowed 3 lbs. Non-winners of $12,000 once allowed 5 lbs. Non-winners of $8,000 once allowed 7 lb s. Field limited to 11 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AUGUST RAIN broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of PISCO in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, got the better of his pace rival entering the lane, and was all out to fend off a late surge from DIOCLES to prevail. DIOCLES settled well off the contested early pace while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and shifted two wide in deep stretch while splitting rivals to just miss. HORATIO stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, commenced his bid two out from the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to just miss. PISCO away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the lane, and faded in the late going. HIGHLINER rushed up along the inside entering the first turn while clipping heels with BECKETT'S BEST entering the turn, settled off the early pace while saving ground in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished evenly from along the rail in the drive. BECKETT'S BEST away well and settled off the early pace while racing along the inside in the run to the first turn, was ran into from behind entering the first turn and briefly knocked off stride, settled three wide in the run down the backside, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive. RICK'S DANCER settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to make a late impact. FRASER LANDING was off awkwardly, and settled well off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but failed to launch a serious late bid. NORTHERN FORCE unhurried early while dropping back to trail, was always well back and failed to make a late impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Rick's Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Highliner
ENTRY.COMMENT: clipped heels 5/8, settled inside, rallied 2w, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Fraser Landing
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked kick

ENTRY.NAME: Diocles
ENTRY.OWNER: Wil - A - Way Farm Jewsbury Gail C and Jarvis Pat
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Northern Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Beckett's Best
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Pisco
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Horatio
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: August Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming, And Starter Races Not Considered For Allowances) (Preference To Horses ThatH ave Not Started For Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOLD ARCH rushed up from along the rail to vie for the lead entering he first turn, opened a clear advantage through the final turn, and was all out to hold off a late surge by JUST JIMMY to prevail. JUST JIMMY away alertly and stalked the dueling leaders while racing one out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied smartly from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed with a rush three wide in the drive to just miss. SET TO SHINE settled at the back of the pack while racing three wide entering the backstretch, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly four wide in the drive to garner a share. SIR BREGOVIC away well and pressed the pace from the outside of BOLD ARCH entering the first turn, continued to force the issue two wide into the final turn, but was outfinished in the late stages. SMART LAD broke sharply and tracking the dueling leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied two wide into the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid. BE QUICK settled off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering he backstretch, was always well back and failed to respond when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Bold Arch
ENTRY.OWNER: Morrison, John and Kim and Sadler, Robin
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Lad
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Be Quick
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, lacked kick

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Bregovic
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Set to Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Just Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 2 w, rallied inside, closed 3w, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BC Cup Sir Winston Churchill Derby Trial H. HASTINGS RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 90. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday July 23, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back. High Weights preferred. Lifetime earnings as recorded by Equibase will be used in determining preference of horses assigned equal weigh ts. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUNBIRD away well and vied for the lead from the inside of BAK TO LIBERTY through the stretch the first time, continued to fight for the lead from along the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, took control through the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. LEGACY SQUARE lagged well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, was shuffled back to trail entering the second turn, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and closed determinedly five wide in the drive to get up for the place. ACCIDENTAL HERO lagged well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, steadied briefly shortly after entering the lane, and finished three out from the rail in the drive to get up for a share. SPACE stalked the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive in a solid effort. LUCKY FORCE tracked the leaders through the stretch while racing one out from the rail, maintained his tracking trip two wide in the run down the backside, tipped three wide to loom a danger approaching the final turn. PURSUE lagged well off the early pace while racing three wide through the stretch the first time, commenced his bid four wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. TAPITS CHOICE settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. ROCKCLIFFE settled off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail , dropped back to trail in the run to the final turn, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a serious late impact. BAK TO LIBERTY away alertly and raced to the lead two wide through the stretch the first time, forced the issue two wide into the backstretch, was unable to keep tabs on his pace rival entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong. WICKED NIGHT broke sharply and stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, struggled to maintain his position racing into the final turn, and had little to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Legacy Square
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged rail, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rockcliffe
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, trailed, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Sunbird
ENTRY.OWNER: Felicella Pauline and Estate of Nick Felicella
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Night
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Tapits Choice
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, Gary C., Pumpkin Stable and Sharlea Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Pursue
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Accidental Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Space
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Bak to Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BC Cup Classic H. HASTINGS RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 98. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, July 29, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to thir d, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% to sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back. High Weights preferred. Total earnings as recorded by Equibase in 2022-2023 will be used in determining preference of ho rses assigned equal weights. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AT ATTENTION tracked the dueling leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground along the inside, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, shifted two wide into the lane, and ran down SOARINGFORTHESUN late to prove best. SOARINGFORTHESUN away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside and into the final turn, held a clear advantage into the lane, and just failed to last. AROLLERCOASTERRIDE tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, commenced his rallied from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished with late interest three wide in the drive to just miss the place. PAY MY WAY settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail through the stretch the first time, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing five wide in the drive. BOITANO settled off the early pace while racing two wide through the stretch the first time, launched his bid four wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a serious late impact three out from the rail in the drive. BIG UNION tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, dropped back to trail approaching the final turn, rallied two wide into the turn, but needed more when called upon. FLORIDA GATOR away well and pressed the pace three wide through the stretch the first time, continued three wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but weakened over the final furlong. ROOKIE YEAR broke sharply and dueled for the lead from between rivals through the stretch the first time, continued to press the pace in the run down the backside, rallied two wide into the final turn, checked when in tight quarters midway through the turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: At Attention
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, best

ENTRY.NAME: Arollercoasterride
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied rail, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 5 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, trailed, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, weakened

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,
